issue.title: [CF 719] tell me when error
issue.body:
Hello,

I downloaded the new verison on tell me when 6.1.1 still having the same error as I did yesterday (11-28-2012). I have attaced the error string. Any suggestions or assistance would be welcome and thank you for you time.

"A complete restart of wow is required to use tellmewhen 6.1.1: Iconview.luna was not found" would you like to restart wow? If I cancle tellmewhen disappears from my addon option list. If I do exit wow and I re-log in I get the same error :

Date: 2012-11-29 16:58:44
ID: 1
Error occured in: Global
Count: 1
Message: ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua line 110:
   bad argument #1 to 'pairs' (table expected, got nil)
Debug:
   (tail call): ?
   [C]: ?
   [C]: pairs()
   ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:110: in main chunk
   [C]: ?
   TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:2952: LoadOptions()
   [string "*:OnShow"]:1:
      [string "*:OnShow"]:1
   [C]: Show()
   ..\FrameXML\InterfaceOptionsFrame.lua:28: InterfaceOptionsList_DisplayPanel()
   ..\FrameXML\InterfaceOptionsFrame.lua:46: InterfaceOptionsListButton_OnClick()
   [string "*:OnClick"]:2:
      [string "*:OnClick"]:1
Locals:
None
AddOns:
  Swatter, v4.0.1 (<%codename%>)
  Babylonian, v5.1.DEV.312(/embedded)
  clcEclipseBar, v
  Configator, v5.1.DEV.330(/embedded)
  DBMBurningCrusade, v
  DBMCore, v
  DBMLDB, v
  Decursive, v2.7.2.2
  Gatherer, v4.0.1
  Recount, v
  SlideBar, v4.0.1 (<%codename%>)
  TellMeWhen, v6.1.1
  TellMeWhenOptions, v
  BlizRuntimeLib_enUS v5.1.0.50100 <us>
  (ck=15c)


> Posted by CurseForge user james850401 | Imported from CurseForge issue #719 | Raw

comments.body:
Attachment Added: FrameXML.log

FrameXML.log

<p>FrameXML.log</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user james850401

Thanks for reporting this. I have a few questions for you:

How long have you been using TellMeWhen (a few days, a few weeks, months, years, etc.)?

How long has this error been happening?

Do you use a nolib version? (Or, if using the Curse Client, do you have the "Install Libraries Separately" option enabled)? (If you don't know, the answer is probably no).

It seems that you are having the same issue that was reported in this ticket: http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/tickets/613-starts-game-with-iconview-lua-error/ and I still have no idea why this error happens. Any information that you could provide would be helpful (especially if you are a long-time user of TellMeWhen, have you made any other changes related to WoW addons or settings lately?)

Edited Nov 29, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Hello,

I have been using tellmewhen addon for a few months now. This error started to happen after the latest WOW update 5.1. The addon was working perfect until then. I have not made any other changes to the Interface/addons folder of wow. I do not use the curse client, as I download my addons to my desktop and and move them directly into the Interface/addons folder. I have been using that medoth ever since WOW can out and have not had an issue before.

I hope that helps narrow it down? Again thank you for your time and any assistance you might be able to provide.


> Posted by CurseForge user james850401

Does it still happen if you delete TellMeWhen and TellMeWhen_Options out of your Interface/Addons folder before moving the downloaded files into the folder (or do you already do this)?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Also, could you go into the World Of Warcraft\Logs folder and upload FrameXML.log ?

And what operating system are you running on your computer?

Edited Nov 29, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Hello I have deleted the addon and re-installed it and still getting the same error. I'm running windows7 64bit OS. I have also attached the FrameXML.log .

Hope this helps.


> Posted by CurseForge user james850401

OK, thank you. It looks like the exact same thing is happening here that was happening in the other report of this issue - WoW is attempting to load TMW's files from the wrong locations for some reason.

I have an idea about how to fix this and I will try it when I get time tonight.

Before I do that, could I get you to test one more thing? Open the WoW launcher, go into the Options menu, select Game Preferences, and enable the option to launch the 32 bit client. Then, start WoW. You don't have to leave this option enabled, but I would just like to see if it will fix the problem.

Edited Nov 30, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Greetings,

I checked the 32bit option still same problem. I'm going to try to install the curse game client and reinstall tellmewhen. I'll report my findings in a few.


> Posted by CurseForge user james850401

@Cybeloras: Go

Ok I know this is going to drive us both nuts but... for some reason when I installed via the curse client it is now working properly in both 32 biit mode and in non 32bit mode. Maybe by adding the curse client it updated some files???

Not sure but I guess i won't look a gift horse in the mouth :)

Thank you very much for all your assistance and time. Maybe the person with the same problem could try the same thing I did it might work for them?


> Posted by CurseForge user james850401

Ok, glad to hear that you got it figured out. I will see if I can find any dirfferences between the curse client download and the regular file download. I am baffled as to why the curse client fixed things, but as you said, I won't look a gift horse in the mouth! I did recommend installing through the curse client in the other ticket, and I didn't get any response, so maybe that fixed it for other people as well. At least now I know that this is a way to fix the problem! Thanks for sticking with me on this problem!


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

My pleasure

Best Regards, james850401


> Posted by CurseForge user james850401
